defs: = ಕ್ಷಣಭಂಗುರ.
a casual, passing look.
that which inflicts pain instantly.
every moment; each moment.
a fraction of 'ಕ್ಷಣ'.
a minute, very short period of time.
a duration of twenty four seconds.
a minute, very short period of time.
that lives, prevails, exists for a few seconds.
lasting or of use for only a short time; transitory; ephemeral; transient.
the quality of being for only a short time; transitoriness.
absence of firmness, steadiness in taking decision; the unsteady mind; vacillation.
the quality or fact of passing away with time, not being permanent; temporariness; transiency.
vacillation of the mind.
= ಕ್ಷಣಿಕತೆ.
= ಕ್ಷಣಪ್ರಭೆ.
wounded; injured; hurt.
an injury done to living tissue by a cut or blow etc., esp. beyond the cutting or piercing of the skin.
an injury to a person's reputation or a pain inflicted on a person's feelings.
that which comes out or produced in a wound (as blood, pus, etc.).
the act of protecting (someone or something) from danger, injury, etc.
a protective armour used to prevent (one's body) from being hurt or injured.
heavily wounded or injured.
a man who has failed in accomplishing his vow or fulfilling a solemn oath.
an injury to the body in which the skin or other tissue is broken, cut, pierced, torn, etc.; a wound.
an injury to a plant caused by cutting, scraping or other external force.
any hurt or injury to the feelings, honour, etc.
the tree Ziziphus glabrata ( = Z. trinerva) of Rhamnaceae family; jagged jujube tree.
a person on duty at the door to a large building; a door-keeper; a doorman.
a driver of a chariot; a charioteer.
a male offspring of śudra male and a woman of military caste or of tradesman community.
a son of a house-maid.
relating to the ruling power, caste or ethics.
= ಕ್ಷತ್ರಿಯ.
a multitude, assemblage of military men or rulers.
loss of judgement power, vision, caused by one's military power or one's physical strength.

the glory, dignity of one's military status or power.
the collective ethics, morals which a ruler or a military man must follow.

a king; a ruler.

the profession, service of or befitting a military man.

the fourth of four canonical collections of hymns, prayers and liturgical formulas, which also has large number of forms of imprecations for the destruction of enemies and also contains prayers for safety and averting mishaps, evils, sins; Atharva Vēda.
= ಕ್ಷತ್ರಿಯಾಧಮ.

water.
the whole physical structure and substance of a human being or animal; the body.
one of the four major social class in ancient India, whose main occupation was military service or ruling a state.
a man belonging to this class.
the military class, in gen.

the act of destroying or rendering very weak.

that is abnormally lean or weak.

a man in the advanced years of his life, when strength and vigour have declined; an old man.

the end of something in space or time; limit, bound, conclusion or finish; termination; destruction.

an infectious disease caused by the tubercle bacillus and characterised by the formation of tubercles in various tissues of the body; tuberculosis; consumption.

milk - a) a white or yellowish emulsion secreted by the mammary glands of female mammals for suckling their young and usu. consisting of fats, proteins, sugars, vitamins, and minerals suspended in water; b) cow's milk or, sometimes, that of goats, camels, etc., drunk by humans as a food or used to make butter, cheese, casein products, etc.; c) any liquid like this, as the juice of various plants or fruits (e.g., coconut milk) or any of various emulsions.

wanting or taking all that one can get, with no thought of others' needs; greedy; miserly.

a man lacking the necessities of life or living in complete poverty; a poor man; a destitute.
a mean, small-minded; contemptible man.
a sweet sticky yellowish fluid made by bees and other insects from nectar collected from flowers; honey.

any small insect of the widely distributed hymenopterous family Formicidae; an ant.
light from the sun; sunlight.

the quality of being mean, narrow, petty ungenerous, small-minded; pettiness; small-mindedness.

ಕ್ಷುದ್ರ ಕೇಳುವವನು ಶೂದ್ರನಿಗಿಂತ ಕಡೆ kṣudra kēḷuvavanu śudraniginta kaḍe (prov.) to heed to a slanderer is the abuse of human in oneself.
a kind of lung disease.
a woman having the tendency to make false or malicious statements about a person in his or her absence, intending to injure or defame; a female slanderer.
a kind of lung disease.
any of the thousands of small planets ranging from 1,000 km to less than one km in diameter, with orbits usu. between those of Mars and Jupiter; a minor planet; a planetoid; an asteroid.
(astrol.) either of the planets Rāhu or Kētu, considered as semi-planets, but ruling the destiny of all living beings.
a small chiming bell (as the one attached to an ornament, as anklet, girdle, etc).
an ornament (as anklet, girdle, etc.) that is attached with a set of small chiming bells.
an insignificant or contemptible person or creature.
(used as pl.) petty, mean or contemptible people.

the quality of being petty, small-minded; pettiness.

the plant, Oxalis corniculata ( = O. pusilla, = Xanthoxalis corniculata) of Oxalidaceae family, with small, trifoliate leaves and white flowers streaked with purple; wood-sorrel.
